trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database connectivity issues
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database connectivity issues

trans-unit.source: Identifying and determining SQL Database connection failures.
trans-unit.target: Identifying and determining SQL Database connection failures.

trans-unit.source: SQL Database Connection Issues
trans-unit.target: SQL Database Connection Issues

trans-unit.source: This article provides an overview on how to use various troubleshooters when you cannot connect to Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an overview on how to use various troubleshooters when you cannot connect to Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Determine if the connectivity issue is specific to an individual application, or if you simply cannot connect to the database?
trans-unit.target: Determine if the connectivity issue is specific to an individual application, or if you simply cannot connect to the database?

trans-unit.source: Use SQL Server Management Studio or SQLCMD.EXE to verify that you can connect to the database.
trans-unit.target: Use SQL Server Management Studio or SQLCMD.EXE to verify that you can connect to the database.

trans-unit.source: For directions on connecting to SQL Database with SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), see <link><linkText>How to connect to an Azure SQL Database with SSMS</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For directions on connecting to SQL Database with SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), see <link><linkText>How to connect to an Azure SQL Database with SSMS</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For directions on connecting to SQL Database with SQLCMD, see <link><linkText>How to: Connect to Azure SQL Database Using sqlcmd</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For directions on connecting to SQL Database with SQLCMD, see <link><linkText>How to: Connect to Azure SQL Database Using sqlcmd</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Is the application trying to connect to SQL Database running in Azure (for example, is the application that is failing to connect to the database a Cloud Service or Web App)?
trans-unit.target: Is the application trying to connect to SQL Database running in Azure (for example, is the application that is failing to connect to the database a Cloud Service or Web App)?

trans-unit.source: Ensure that firewall rule to allow all Azure services is enabled for the server/database.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that firewall rule to allow all Azure services is enabled for the server/database.

trans-unit.source: For information about firewall rules and enabling connections from Azure, see <link><linkText>Azure SQL Database Firewall</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about firewall rules and enabling connections from Azure, see <link><linkText>Azure SQL Database Firewall</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Is the application trying to connect to SQL Database from a private network?
trans-unit.target: Is the application trying to connect to SQL Database from a private network?

trans-unit.source: Ensure that firewall rules to allow access from specific network(s) is enabled for the server/database.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that firewall rules to allow access from specific network(s) is enabled for the server/database.

trans-unit.source: For general information about firewall rules, see <link><linkText>Azure SQL Database Firewall</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For general information about firewall rules, see <link><linkText>Azure SQL Database Firewall</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For directions on setting up firewall rules, see <link><linkText>How to: Configure Firewall Settings (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For directions on setting up firewall rules, see <link><linkText>How to: Configure Firewall Settings (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If the firewall rules are configured correctly, then try the <link><linkText>Troubleshoot Microsoft Azure SQL Database connectivity</linkText><title></title></link> guided walkthrough.
trans-unit.target: If the firewall rules are configured correctly, then try the <link><linkText>Troubleshoot Microsoft Azure SQL Database connectivity</linkText><title></title></link> guided walkthrough.

trans-unit.source: The above support article provides help for the following SQL Database connectivity issues:
trans-unit.target: The above support article provides help for the following SQL Database connectivity issues:

trans-unit.source: Cannot open server connection due to firewall settings
trans-unit.target: Cannot open server connection due to firewall settings

trans-unit.source: The server was not found or was not accessible
trans-unit.target: The server was not found or was not accessible

trans-unit.source: Unable to login to the server
trans-unit.target: Unable to login to the server

trans-unit.source: Connection timeout errors
trans-unit.target: Connection timeout errors

trans-unit.source: Transient errors
trans-unit.target: Transient errors

trans-unit.source: Connection Terminated due to hitting some system-defined limit
trans-unit.target: Connection Terminated due to hitting some system-defined limit

trans-unit.source: Connections failing from SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS)
trans-unit.target: Connections failing from SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS)

trans-unit.source: Additional Information
trans-unit.target: Additional Information

trans-unit.source: For additional information about connecting to SQL Database, see <link><linkText>Guidelines for Connecting to Azure SQL Database Programmatically</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For additional information about connecting to SQL Database, see <link><linkText>Guidelines for Connecting to Azure SQL Database Programmatically</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Details about specific connection errors can be found in the Transient faults, Connection-loss errors section in Error messages for SQL Database client programs.
trans-unit.target: Details about specific connection errors can be found in the Transient faults, Connection-loss errors section in Error messages for SQL Database client programs.

trans-unit.source: Connection event data can be accessed by querying for connectivity events using the <link><linkText>**sys.event_log (Azure SQL Database)**</linkText><title></title></link> view.
trans-unit.target: Connection event data can be accessed by querying for connectivity events using the <link><linkText>**sys.event_log (Azure SQL Database)**</linkText><title></title></link> view.

trans-unit.source: Metrics of database connectivity events can be accessed by querying the <link><linkText>**sys.database_connection_stats (Azure SQL Database)**</linkText><title></title></link> view.
trans-unit.target: Metrics of database connectivity events can be accessed by querying the <link><linkText>**sys.database_connection_stats (Azure SQL Database)**</linkText><title></title></link> view.
